metadata.title: CVE-2019-20372 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
NGINX before 1.17.7, with certain error_page configurations, allows HTTPrequest smuggling, as demonstrated by the ability of an attacker to readunauthorized web pages in environments where NGINX is being fronted by aload balancer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20372` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnginx-mod-http-auth-pam - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-cache-purge - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-dav-ext - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-echo - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-fancyindex - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-headers-more-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-image-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-lua - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-ndk - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-perl - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-subs-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-uploadprogress - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-upstream-fair - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-http-xslt-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-mail - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-nchan - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-rtmp - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
libnginx-mod-stream - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
nginx - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
nginx-common - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
nginx-core - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
nginx-extras - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
nginx-full - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
nginx-light - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.0-0ubuntu1.7').
